column4: I'm running xubuntu, and I would like to know how to change the default terminal to be xterm, instead of "Terminal"
when ever ubuntu needs a term, it opens that Terminal program, but I'd like to use xterm instead
how can I find out what it is set to right now?
he's probably been told not to repeat ;)
well, not that then; I used to have some extravagant prompts, but they didn't have noticeable overhead
as an experiment, you could try from a VT xinit -- :1 and then run xterm from the term that appears automagically
was it the same in a bare X server started with xinit?
I'm looking to blame gnome here ;)
better to do xinit -- :1 from a VT IMHO
oh, no gnome to vilify then, damn ;)
